  • Become tenants

How to become a tenant

Before purchasing a Manufactured Home in American Presidential Estates or Capitol Hills, all prospective homeowners must apply to the Community for tenancy. You will need the following:

  1. All persons who will be listed on the title to the home must complete an application for tenancy and be approved by Management.

  2. Sign an agreement that the home will meet all community requirements

  3. Sign for and receive a copy of the Community Guidelines.

  4. Sign authorization for us to obtain a credit/background check.

    There is a one time $45.00 non-refundable credit check charge payable at the time of application.

    Applicants should have a credit score of 620 or better and have a history free of bankruptcies and repossessions.

  5. Sign authorization for us to obtain information from your previous landlord/s.

  6. Proof of Employment

    A recent pay stub

    Last years W-2

  7. Submit a purchase agreement for the home you want to purchase.

    If you are bringing a new Manufactured Home into the community please provide specific home information including pier/foundation requirements.
